titlestmt.subtitle: A description of the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: BMF

list.item: 24 July 2017 - Biographical history corrected and inventory added (PJM)

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Bell Brothers Collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of non-commercial recordings on 78RPM, 45RPM, and 33RPM phonograph records and 1/4 inch audio tapes.
did.langmaterial: Majority of material is in English, also some items in Spanishand Portuguese.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Joseph and Max Bell established the Bell Music Box record shop in Manhattan, New York City following World War II. The brothers were Russian immigrants, who spent time in Cuba before coming to America. While in Cuba, they took an interest in Spanish language recordings as well as the music of the Caribbean. Their store was known to record aficionados and collectors nationwide and was comprehensive in its breadth -- if they did not have a copy of a particular recording, they would make their own. As a result, their inventory contained both commercially produced and sold recordings, and personal copies made for their own reference and use.

In 1963, Syracuse University purchased the entire inventory of the Bell Brothers' store. Commercial recordings were integrated into the Belfer Commercial Phonograph Disc Recordings. Latin American and Caribbean recordings were separated into the Bell Brothers Collection of Latin American and Caribbean Recordings. Noncommercial recordings were retained as the Bell Brothers Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Bell Brothers Collection consists of instantaneous disc recordings, many of them transcriptions of radio broadcasts, as well as dubbed copies of commercial releases made on site at the Bell Music Box. For ease of locating a specific title, the inventory below lists items alphabetically by title, though they are not physically arranged in this order.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Arranged by format. Within that, items are physically arranged sequentially by ID number.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
See also the
Belfer Commercial Phonograph Disc Collection and the
Bell Brothers Collection of Latin American and Caribbean Recordings.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Commercial recordings were integrated into the Belfer Commercial Phonograph Disc Recordings. Latin American and Caribbean recordings were separated into the Bell Brothers Collection of Latin American and Caribbean Recordings.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
